qas.question: What term was coined in the 16th century to indicate present time?
The term "modern" was derived from what Latin adverb?
What caused the transition between the middle ages and early modern times?
In what country did The European Renaissance start?
What two instruments were invented during The European Renaissance?
What phrase was coined in the 16th century to reference recent times?
The phrase modern originated form what?
What did The European renaissance mark?

answers.text: transition between the Late Middle Ages and Early Modern times

qas.question: Through what time period did The European renaissance last?
In what country did The European renaissance begin?

context: The term "<a0_0><a5_0>modern<a5_0/><a0_0/>" was coined in the 16th century to indicate present or recent times (ultimately derived from the <a6_0>Latin adverb <a1_0>modo<a6_0/><a1_0/>, meaning "just now). <a2_0>The European Renaissance<a2_0/> (about <a8_0>1420–1630)<a8_0/>, which marked the <a7_0>transition between the Late Middle Ages and Early Modern times<a7_0/>, started in <a3_0><a9_0>Italy<a9_0/><a3_0/> and was spurred in part by the rediscovery of classical art and literature, as well as the new perspectives gained from the Age of Discovery and the invention of the <a4_0>telescope and microscope<a4_0/>, expanding the borders of thought and knowledge.
